definition: looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: Madame Merle was not superficial-not she.
sentences.chinese: 梅爾夫人決不虛有其表，她是表裏如一的。

sentences.english: His fine clothes are a mere facade, facade .
sentences.chinese: 他漂亮的衣着只是虛有其表而已。
那部車的堅固外觀只是虛有其表。

sentences.english: You have a superficial brightness that can fool some people but underneath you're empty.
sentences.chinese: 你這個人好象很精明，能唬得了人，可是虛有其表。

sentences.english: For the most part, my aversion to online dating is about vanity.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭網絡相親的最大原因在於其虛有其表。

sentences.english: You wear a superficial brightness that Can fool some people, but underneath you're empty.
sentences.chinese: 你這個人好像很精明，能騙一些人，可是虛有其表。

sentences.english: His fine clothes are a mere facade.
sentences.chinese: 他漂亮的衣着只是虛有其表而已。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
political correctness/politically correct
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to become a mere formality
political enemy/opponent
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
to force someone to do something
to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
complete nonsense (idiom)
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to exaggerate
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
arbitrary/subjective/dogmatic
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
